mdRecord.dcterms:title: The law of charitable uses, as laid down and digested by George Duke, Esq., in 1676, together with the learned readings of Sir Francis Moore, printed from his own manuscript. To which is now added, the law of mortmain, as established by the statute of 9 George II. c. 36; the whole continued to the present time. Enlightened by an abridgment of all the adjudged cases, particularly adapted to the use of every professor of the law, as well as all bishops, cathedrals, colleges, parishes, and all corporations, ecclesiastical as well as civil; and all eleemosynary foundations,
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Duke, George, Esq
Moore, Francis, 1558-1621
Bridgman, Richard Whalley, 1761?-1820
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Charitable uses, trusts, and foundations--Great Britain
Mortmain--Great Britain
